channel.title: EF on Ranbo's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in EF on Ranbo's Blog

item.title: Use EF In DotNet Core
item.description: How to create entity in dotnet core Install Packages First of all, you need install the packages that needed to create the entitys through the nuget package manager. Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Tools Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Relational Pomelo.EntityFrameworkCore.MySql Create Entity Then you can create entitys with the following command at the console. For Mysql: Scaffold-DbContext -Provider Pomelo.EntityFrameworkCore.MySql -Context DBContext -Project Common -Connection "Server=192.168.10.100;User Id=ranbo;Password=ranBo000;Database=FILECTLSYS" -outputdir DBModel For Sql: Scaffold-DbContext -Force “Server=192.168.10.100;Database=FILECTLSYS;User ID=ranbo;Password=ranBo000;” Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer -OutputDir DBModel
